body: [gRPC-ProtoRPC.podspec](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/gRPC-ProtoRPC.podspec#L64) may need to be updated for beta-4
It's also blocked by https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/7479 anyway so we're most probably going to have to use something newer than `-beta4` for GA.
Ok, now that Protobuf 3 is GA, I'm going to repurpose this PR to advance to that :)
Please test this.

Hey @y-zeng, what do I have to do to satisfy [this test you wrote](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/v1.0.x/tools/distrib/check_generated_pb_files.sh) after updating the version of protobuf we use? It's failing on Jenkins.

@jcanizales It's also failing since [lcov is not properly installed](https://grpc-testing.appspot.com/job/gRPC_pull_requests/config=gcov,language=php7,platform=linux/11376/console), which is triggered when running the [`tools/run_tests/build_php.sh`](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/v1.0.x/tools/run_tests/build_php.sh) script:

```
configure: error: To enable code coverage reporting you must have one of the following LCOV versions installed: 1.5 1.6 1.7 1.9 1.10 1.11
Command exited with non-zero status 1
real 1.50
user 0.82
sys 0.15

FAILED: tools/run_tests/build_php.sh [ret=1, pid=4827]
```

Hope it helps,
~p
@nicolasnoble: Can you check out what's up with lcov in the Jenkins runner?

Hi @jcanizales, you can run [tools/codegen/extensions/gen_reflection_proto.sh](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/tools/codegen/extensions/gen_reflection_proto.sh) to update the generated files.

Hey @jtattermusch, what does [this C# test failure](https://grpc-testing.appspot.com/job/gRPC_pull_requests/11764/config=opt,language=csharp,platform=windows/testReport/%28root%29/tests/csharp_Grpc_Core_Tests_SanityTest/) mean? If it's not a flake, how can it be fixed?
@apolcyn Can you take a look at that C# failure?

@jcanizales: Try the following update to [line 111 in SanityTest.cs](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/f14effb6e421601639ef9a293f3f9b55a51e87ed/src/csharp/Grpc.Core.Tests/SanityTest.cs#L65):

``` C#
Assert.AreEqual(discoveredTests.ToString().Replace('\r',''), testsFromFile.ToString());
```

or this more complete one:

``` C#
Assert.AreEqual(discoveredTests.ToString().Replace('\r','').Replace('\n',''), testsFromFile.ToString().Replace('\r','').Replace('\n',''));
```

Based on the error the difference seems to be just that the `\r` (carriage return) is included:

```
1) Failed : Grpc.Core.Tests.SanityTest.TestsJsonUpToDate
  Expected string length 2087 but was 2036. Strings differ at index 1.
  Expected: "{\r\n  "Grpc.Core.Tests": [\r\n    "Grpc.Core.Internal.Tests.Asyn..."
  But was:  "{\n  "Grpc.Core.Tests": [\n    "Grpc.Core.Internal.Tests.AsyncC..."
```

The [`json.text`](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/f14effb6e421601639ef9a293f3f9b55a51e87ed/src/csharp/tests.json) file contains not carriage return, and only the newline character (`\n`) as noted here - probably because it might have been generated on a Unix-type machine:

``` Bash
$ grep $'\r' ./src/csharp/tests.json
$ grep $'\n' ./src/csharp/tests.json
{
  "Grpc.Core.Tests": [
    "Grpc.Core.Internal.Tests.AsyncCallServerTest",
    "Grpc.Core.Internal.Tests.AsyncCallTest",
    "Grpc.Core.Internal.Tests.ChannelArgsSafeHandleTest",
    "Grpc.Core.Internal.Tests.CompletionQueueEventTest",
    "Grpc.Core.Internal.Tests.CompletionQueueSafeHandleTest",
...
$
```

Hope it helps,
Paul

@jcanizales, @pgrosu, there is a fix for this on master, for which I also
have a copy that I needed to merge into v1.0.x too. It is here:
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/7598

thanks,
Alex

Awesome. Next one is for @iamqizhao, a Go docker problem:

```
Cloning into 'src/google.golang.org/grpc'...
done.
Note: checking out '35896af9ad39c1fb1b1cd925fe3621be361e3d81'.

You are in 'detached HEAD' state. You can look around, make experimental
changes and commit them, and you can discard any commits you make in this
state without impacting any branches by performing another checkout.

If you want to create a new branch to retain commits you create, you may
do so (now or later) by using -b with the checkout command again. Example:

  git checkout -b new_branch_name

/go/src/golang.org/x/oauth2/google/default.go:17:2: cannot find package "cloud.google.com/go/compute/metadata" in any of:
    /usr/local/go/src/cloud.google.com/go/compute/metadata (from $GOROOT)
    /go/src/cloud.google.com/go/compute/metadata (from $GOPATH)
+ EXITCODE=1
+ docker rm -f build_grpc_interop_go_e415a90d-f0e3-4ecd-b2ac-632062955733
build_grpc_interop_go_e415a90d-f0e3-4ecd-b2ac-632062955733
+ exit 1

FAILED: build_docker_go [ret=1, pid=15135]
```
@jcanizales  Awww, but the problem is too easy :)  How about a harder one for me?

@pgrosu I hope that's the last one! You're more than welcome to give me a fix, because I've never used docker and only once done a Go tutorial. Sounds like a Go package for Google Cloud Compute wasn't installed.

@jcanizales   I will gladly teach you Docker, but to fix this immediate issue, please add the following line just above line 45 of [build_interop.sh](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/tools/dockerfile/interoptest/grpc_interop_go/build_interop.sh#L45) - yes, you are right it was missing [the package](https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/cloud/compute/metadata) to access GCE metadata, which is needed in [this file](https://github.com/golang/oauth2/blob/master/google/default.go#L17):

```
go get google.golang.org/cloud/compute/metadata
```

Basically the updated version should look something like this for those lines:

```
go get google.golang.org/cloud/compute/metadata
go get github.com/golang/protobuf/proto
go get golang.org/x/net/context
go get golang.org/x/net/trace
go get golang.org/x/oauth2
go get google.golang.org/cloud
```

If the `oauth2` package requires more, then we might have it download the dependencies like this - but we can try that if the above does not work:

```
go get golang.org/x/oauth2/...
```

Let me know if that worked.

Thanks,
~p

@jcanizales  I have this strange suspicion that the directories are not being [mapped correctly](https://docs.docker.com/engine/tutorials/dockervolumes/) from the Jenkins host.  So to test this hypothesis, could you please update [line 95 of `build_interop_image.sh`](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/tools/run_tests/dockerize/build_interop_image.sh#L95) to the following, and then rerun the build:

``` Bash
bash -l -c 'go get google.golang.org/cloud/compute/metadata && bash /var/local/jenkins/grpc/tools/dockerfile/interoptest/$BASE_NAME/build_interop.sh' \
```

Sorry to bother you like this,
~p
Not bothered at all; I appreciate your help a lot.

@jcanizales  It is my fault, I just realized it is the same package with a slightly different path, so please replace it with the following specific one, and ignore my [bash test](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/7475#issuecomment-237722881) above:

```
go get cloud.google.com/go/compute/metadata
```

The one I gave you before was the following - with `cloud` instead of `go` in the path - but it specifically is looking for the one above, even though their GoDoc descriptions seem to be same ([loc1](https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/cloud/compute/metadata) vs [loc2](https://godoc.org/cloud.google.com/go/compute/metadata)): 

```
google.golang.org/cloud/compute/metadata
```

So if you could try this small update and see if it fixes it, that would be great.

Sorry about that,
Paul

@jcanizales So it looks like the package issue was resolved #7653, so our fix https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/7475/commits/31871df58f2a99b21c7a85aebac73ed6d9bdaf9b can be removed and this PR rebased to match master.  Hopefully then resubmitting the other fixes in this PR to Jenkins for rebuilding would make it all work again :)

@jcanizales I think you might need to change the `build_interop.sh` file is it looks different than master - or rebase and resubmit the changes :)

From this PR:

https://github.com/jcanizales/grpc/blob/0db98cda0d81de2117501fd62020a7bbe6095eee/tools/dockerfile/interoptest/grpc_interop_go/build_interop.sh

On master:

https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/tools/dockerfile/interoptest/grpc_interop_go/build_interop.sh

There's also has a version by @menghanl that works at #7655 to try, if the above does not work.
Argh, I didn't see that PR #7653 was merged into master instead of the v1 branch...

We found a Contributor License Agreement for you (the sender of this pull request) and all commit authors, but as best as we can tell these commits were authored by someone else.  If that's the case,  please add them to this pull request and have them confirm that they're okay with these commits being contributed to Google.  If we're mistaken and you did author these commits, just reply here to confirm.

<!-- need_author_consent -->
Yay the Interop tests pass :)
Have a great weekend Jorge!
You too, and thanks again for the help!
